revised_title: Existence and Properties of Static Spherically Symmetric Solutions of a Yang-Mills Field Coupled to a Dilaton
tldr: The authors provide a detailed analytical study of static spherically symmetric solutions for a Yang-Mills field coupled to a dilaton field. They prove the existence of a countable infinity of such solutions satisfying the relevant boundary conditions and discuss their properties. This work contributes to the understanding of particle-like solutions in nonlinear field theories and the interplay between gravitational attraction and Yang-Mills self-interaction.
